name: Dr. Sarah Mitchell
expertise: Climate modeling, renewable energy systems, carbon capture
bio: Leading researcher in climate modeling with 15+ years of experience. Specializes in developing predictive models for climate change impacts and renewable energy integration.
recent_work: Published breakthrough study on carbon capture efficiency in Nature Climate Change
collaboration_notes: Experienced with media interviews and public speaking

name: Prof. Michael Rodriguez
expertise: Machine learning, neural networks, computer vision
bio: Professor of Computer Science specializing in AI applications for scientific discovery. Research focuses on machine learning algorithms and their real-world applications.
recent_work: Developed new neural network architecture for medical image analysis
collaboration_notes: Prefers written communication, has appeared on tech podcasts

name: Dr. Lisa Chen
expertise: Brain plasticity, cognitive enhancement, memory formation
bio: Neuroscientist studying brain plasticity and memory formation. Research aims to understand how the brain adapts and learns throughout life.
recent_work: Discovered new mechanisms of synaptic plasticity in aging brains
collaboration_notes: Excellent at explaining complex concepts, comfortable with video content

name: Dr. James Wilson
expertise: Quantum mechanics, particle physics, theoretical physics
bio: Theoretical physicist working on quantum mechanics and particle physics. Research focuses on understanding fundamental properties of matter and energy.
recent_work: Contributed to major breakthrough in quantum entanglement research
collaboration_notes: Passionate about science education, has YouTube channel experience

name: Prof. Maria Garcia
expertise: Medical devices, tissue engineering, biomaterials
bio: Biomedical engineer developing next-generation medical devices and tissue engineering solutions. Focus on translating research into clinical applications.
recent_work: Developed novel biomaterial for cardiac tissue repair
collaboration_notes: Strong communicator, experience with medical documentaries

name: Dr. David Kim
expertise: Planetary science, astrobiology, Mars exploration
bio: Planetary scientist involved in Mars exploration missions. Research focuses on understanding planetary formation and the potential for life beyond Earth.
recent_work: Key researcher on NASA's Mars Perseverance rover mission
collaboration_notes: Excellent storyteller, comfortable with various media formats

name: Dr. Emily Johnson
expertise: Ocean conservation, marine ecosystems, climate impact on oceans
bio: Marine biologist studying the impact of climate change on ocean ecosystems. Research focuses on coral reef conservation and marine biodiversity.
recent_work: Led international study on coral bleaching recovery mechanisms
collaboration_notes: Passionate about ocean conservation outreach, active on social media

name: Prof. Robert Taylor
expertise: Green chemistry, sustainable materials, catalysis
bio: Chemist developing sustainable materials and green chemistry processes. Research aims to reduce environmental impact of chemical manufacturing.
recent_work: Developed new catalyst system for plastic recycling
collaboration_notes: Strong advocate for science communication, BBC interview experience

name: Dr. Anna Petrov
expertise: Autonomous systems, robot learning, human-robot interaction
bio: Robotics researcher focusing on autonomous systems and human-robot interaction. Research explores how robots can learn and adapt to work alongside humans.
recent_work: Developed breakthrough algorithm for robot learning in unstructured environments
collaboration_notes: Tech-savvy, comfortable with video demonstrations and technical explanations

name: Dr. Thomas Brown
expertise: Renewable energy, energy storage, smart grids
bio: Energy engineer working on renewable energy systems and smart grid technologies. Research focuses on optimizing energy storage and distribution.
recent_work: Published major study on next-generation battery technologies
collaboration_notes: Industry connections, experienced with technical content creation

name: Prof. Thomas W. Malone
institution: MIT Sloan School of Management / MIT Center for Collective Intelligence
expertise: Human-AI 'superminds', collective intelligence in organizations, electronic markets
bio: Founding director of the MIT Center for Collective Intelligence and Patrick J. McGovern Professor of Management. Leading expert on how groups of individuals can act collectively in ways that seem intelligent, with pioneering work on electronic business and human-AI collaboration.
recent_work: Won Best Paper Award at CI 2023 for 'DesignAID: Using Generative AI and Semantic Diversity for Design Inspiration'
collaboration_notes: Author of 'Superminds' book, frequently speaks at conferences, experienced with media interviews

name: Prof. Michael S. Bernstein
expertise: Crowdsourcing, social computing, organizing large-scale crowd work, human-centered AI
bio: Professor of Computer Science and Bass University Fellow at Stanford. Leading researcher in crowdsourcing and social computing, focusing on designing social, societal, and interactive technologies.
recent_work: Co-founder at Simile, continuing research on crowdsourcing marketplaces and social computing platforms
collaboration_notes: Alfred P. Sloan Fellow, UIST Lasting Impact Award winner, featured in The New York Times and TED AI

name: Prof. Panagiotis Ipeirotis
institution: New York University Stern School of Business
expertise: Crowdsourcing, data quality, online labor markets, social media analytics, machine learning
bio: Professor of Technology, Operations, and Statistics and George A. Kellner Faculty Fellow. World's leading expert in building human-machine loop systems that integrate human and machine intelligence.
recent_work: Received 2015 Lagrange Prize in Complex Systems for contributions in social media and crowdsourcing
collaboration_notes: NSF CAREER award recipient, over ten 'Best Paper' awards, excellent at explaining complex technical concepts

name: Prof. Mark Steyvers
expertise: Human-AI collaboration, wisdom of crowds, decision aggregation, Bayesian modeling
bio: Professor and Chair of Cognitive Sciences with joint appointment in Computer Science. Expert in human-AI collaborative systems that optimize for human interaction and team performance.
recent_work: Published 'Bayesian modeling of human-AI complementarity' in PNAS (2022) and 'What Large Language Models Know' in Nature Machine Intelligence (2025)
collaboration_notes: New Investigator Awards from APA, President of Society of Mathematical Psychology, excellent at interdisciplinary collaboration

name: Prof. Saiph Savage
expertise: Civic technology, collective action, crowd empowerment, social computing
bio: Professor focusing on civic technology and collective action platforms. Researches how technology can empower crowds and communities to address social challenges and participate in democratic processes.
recent_work: Developing platforms for civic engagement and community organizing through technology
collaboration_notes: Strong advocate for social justice applications of technology, experienced with community engagement

name: Prof. Alessandro Bozzon
expertise: Human-centered AI, hybrid intelligence, crowd-computer systems, web engineering
bio: Professor at Delft University of Technology specializing in human-centered AI and hybrid intelligence systems. Focuses on designing systems that effectively combine human and artificial intelligence.
recent_work: Leading research on hybrid intelligence systems and human-AI collaboration frameworks
collaboration_notes: Strong international collaboration network, experienced with EU research projects

name: Prof. Kurt Luther
expertise: Crowdsourced investigation, human-AI systems, expert-level collective work, social computing
bio: Professor at Virginia Tech specializing in crowdsourced investigation and human-AI systems. Researches how crowds can perform expert-level work through effective coordination and AI assistance.
recent_work: Developing systems for crowdsourced historical investigation and expert-level collaborative problem solving
collaboration_notes: Expertise in bridging academic research with practical applications, good at public engagement

name: Prof. Orit Peleg
expertise: Collective behavior in biological systems, communication in swarms, bio-inspired algorithms
bio: Assistant Professor studying collective behavior in biological systems, particularly communication and coordination in swarms. Applies insights from biology to develop better algorithms for collective intelligence.
recent_work: Investigating how honeybee colonies make collective decisions and applying insights to artificial swarm systems
collaboration_notes: Excellent at explaining biological concepts to technical audiences, strong interdisciplinary background

name: Prof. Ěmőke-Ágnes Horváth
expertise: Networked crowds, social computation, creative systems, computational social science
bio: Professor researching networked crowds and social computation systems. Focuses on how creative and innovative work emerges from networked collaborations and crowd-based systems.
recent_work: Studying how creative collaborations emerge in networked environments and their impact on innovation
collaboration_notes: Strong background in both computer science and social science, experienced with interdisciplinary research

name: Prof. Anita Williams Woolley
expertise: Team collective intelligence, group performance prediction, social sensitivity in teams
bio: Professor of Organizational Behavior and Associate Dean of Research at Tepper School of Business. Pioneer in measuring collective intelligence in teams and predicting group performance.
recent_work: Seminal 2010 Science paper on collective intelligence factor has been cited over 5000 times, continuing research on team optimization
collaboration_notes: Senior Editor at Organization Science, founding Associate Editor of Collective Intelligence, excellent public speaker

name: Dr. Eshin Jolly
expertise: social neuroscience, science tools, social interactions, cognitive neuroscience, machine learning
bio: Assistant Professor at UC San Diego and founder of the Sciminds Lab. Explores topics in social neuroscience and computation, focusing on how social interactions shape cognitive function and behavior.
recent_work: Hired as Assistant Professor at UC San Diego, and starting the Sciminds Lab to explore topics in social neuroscience and computation.
collaboration_notes: n/a
